text: 2.3 NEURALLY ADJUSTED VENTILATORY ASSIST (NAVA) In NAVA, ventilator support is linked to the neurological component of the patientâ€™s respiratory effort as assessed by transoesophageal electromyography measuring the electrical activity of the diaphragm (EAdi). The amplitude of the ventilator assist is determined by the instantaneous EAdi and the NAVA level set by the clinician. In particular, NAVA improves patient-ventilator interaction, averting the risk of over-assistance and limiting the occurrence of asynchronies.
